alert.note: Alert for Custer (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 15 at 5:55AM MDT until June 17 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Miles City affecting Custer County. .Flood waters moving through the Yellowstone River will reach Forsyth later today and Miles City on Wednesday. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Yellowstone River at Miles City. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Yellowstone River Miles City 14.0 11.5 Wed 5 am 13.4 12.7 10.0 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. A Flood Watch means that flooding is possible. Now is the time to prepare for action in the event flooding occurs. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued bythis evening at 630 PM MDT.
